definition: to urge/to press/to prompt/to rush sb/to hasten sth/to expedite
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: The latest 4- hanky love story by the master of sweet, heartwarming romantic tales.
sentences.chinese: 純愛小說大師的最新愛情催淚彈。

sentences.english: There were reports of teargas used against protesters.
sentences.chinese: 有報道稱對示威者使用了催淚彈。

sentences.english: Tear-gas bombs were set off to break up the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 爲驅散人羣施放了催淚彈。

sentences.english: In some cities, police used batons and tear gas to control angry investors.
sentences.chinese: 在一些城市，警察用警棍及催淚彈控制憤怒的投資者。

sentences.english: Then I watched as they moved in with water cannon and tear gas.
sentences.chinese: 後來我看到他們使用水炮和催淚彈進行干預。

sentences.english: We are being tear-gassed even in our homes.
sentences.chinese: 即使是在自己家裏，他們依然用催淚彈襲擊我們。

sentences.english: The police fire tear-gas shells in an attempt to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察施放催淚彈企圖驅散人羣。

sentences.english: The police fired hundreds of volleys of stun grenades and tear gas to try and clear the area in front of parliament.
sentences.chinese: 警方施放實彈和催淚彈試圖清理議會前的區域。

sentences.english: Perhaps they should have used tear gas.
sentences.chinese: 也許他們應該使用催淚彈吧。

sentences.english: After the warnings, the soldiers in the first row shot teargas into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警告之後，第一行的士兵向人羣射催淚彈。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
to have a fist fight/fist fight/brawl
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
